column4: Hey, can anyone tell me how to generate ssl certificates for virtual hosts on apache?
you can't run ssl on vhosts because of the way secure HTTP works
you need one IP address per SSL host, no way around it
when I examine the host that I now administer, each of the vertual host have their own .pem file... So is what you say true?
well, apache can listen on multiple IPs, so you can do vhosts that way, but you can't do it from just a single IP
each vhost have their own SSLCertificateFile option...
read http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/https - the last paragraph in the limitations section
yes, I understand that. So I can just copy one of the certificates for this particular ssl host?
yes, as long as the domain name matches the SSL certificate of course, you should just be able to specify it in the apache config
well, the domain name doesn't match, that's why I wanted to generate a new one
you may need a chain certificate or something as well depending on how the original vhost was configured, if you have the same apache config file though it should work fine
to get a valid one that is accepted by web browsers, you have to pay
I just want one that identifies itself as the host that is accessed
or you can generate your own CA and generate a cert from that, but it will give a warning in any web browser where the CA cert is not installed
if I wanted to do that, how would I do it?
there is a quick method here: http://www.rpatrick.com/tech/makecert/
i am sure there is more info about this in the apache documentation
